text: any suggestion how to do this: i have a wrapper using pycall to access the ensembles in python: ENS=pyimport(“sklearn.ensemble”). there are several of them but i just want to load them dynamically. Normally, you would access for example “RandomForestClassifier” as ENS.RandomForestClassifier. However, if i assign name to a variable like, rf=“RandomForestClassfier”, how can i programmatically access the pyobject because ENS.rf won’t work or @eval ENS.$rf. basically i want to access the value of rf and use it to ENS.valueof(rf). any idea how to do this?

elements.text: any suggestion how to do this: i have a wrapper using pycall to access the ensembles in python: ENS=pyimport(“sklearn.ensemble”). there are several of them but i just want to load them dynamically. text:
i don’t understand why you can’t pyimport based off user input. Perhaps I’m not understanding the full problem- but this is kind of what I could see being in your package code

```function load_ens_module(name)
    return pyimport("sklearn.ensemble.$name")
end```
